citation.article-title: Methylotenera mobilis gen. nov., sp. nov., an obligately methylamine-utilizing bacterium within the family Methylophilaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methylotenera (Me.thy.lo.ten′er.a. Gr. n. methyl the methyl group; L. fem. adj. tenera delicate; N.L. fem. n. Methylotenera delicate methyl-utilizing organism).
Gram-negative rods, motile by means of a single flagellum.
Do not grow in TGY, LB or Nutrient media.
Utilize methylamine as a single source of carbon, energy and nitrogen, but do not utilize methanol.
Tests for urease and nitrate reduction are negative.
Tests for catalase and oxidase are positive.
Oxidize methylamine via methylamine dehydrogenase and assimilate C1 units via the RuMP pathway.
Major fatty acids are C16 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.
The G+C content of the DNA is 54.3 mol%.
The type species is Methylotenera mobilis.
